Articles.Content:
I'm not too sure why you would want this but...

![cZV68kK.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/cZV68kK.jpg)

Start making LF, take it to 2km and at full throttle it will fly until the coal runs out, which is a very long way. 

Craft file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/f67jromycf6rxu9/Make%20fuel%202.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/gswa9xk3k4gwo65/Make%20fuel%201.craft?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-22T14:58:43Z" title="05/22/2015 02:58  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 22, 2015</time> by Foxster**

Made me start wondering about an ultra-slow flier a few cms above the ground, with a deployed drill... Actually, a car would work. Do the drills anchor themselves? To the SPH!

Rune. Morning inspiration! My favourite.

Edit: nah, a quick test shows that someone at Squad thought of this before I did: the drill needs to be stationary to work. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-22T09:50:04Z" title="05/22/2015 09:50  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 22, 2015</time> by Rune**

> 
> How magnificently steampunk ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

First, blimps, now steampunk? HOLY CRAP!!! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) LET THE SHIP SAIL!!!!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I'm not too sure why you would want this but...

Somewhere in the world, someone would want this xD

It could be cool having motherships that can land on larger bodies but also somewhat effective in space... now when NERVA only using fuel and not oxygen. Pick and choose how much fuel you would need for specific burns. See [Ore is overpowered thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117073-Ore-is-Overpowered). That way you wouldnt have to haul around or balance tanks pending on the next burn.

EDIT: I did miss the first row of that tread. But still. Balancing tank should be simpler.. hmm, maybe not.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-22T11:40:34Z" title="05/22/2015 11:40  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 22, 2015</time> by Umami**

Downloaded craft. Did not resemble images on box. Did not function as desired. 

[![S5HvSAW.png](http://i.imgur.com/S5HvSAW.png)](http://imgur.com/S5HvSAW)

Also, box contained bobcat.

(Are you sure you uploaded the right one?)

Here's one I made:

[![pBPcIJy.png](http://i.imgur.com/pBPcIJy.png)](http://imgur.com/pBPcIJy)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-22T15:56:44Z" title="05/22/2015 03:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 22, 2015</time> by Tw1**

I was thinking of re-purposing the ISRU parts for a steampunk mod a few days ago. Basically, holding tanks would be able to hold coal, and a modified ISRU module would burn the coal and water (which would be storable in liquid fuel tanks, all of this using fuelswitch patch), and produce steam. Steam can be used to drive turbines for electricity, power RCS thrusters, rocket engines, and directly drive steam rover wheels.

EDIT: Here's my version of the steampunk aircraft, the CF-1 Windsplitter

![3DG1zF3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/3DG1zF3.jpg)

Named after the early name for the science of aerodynamics, then called "[windsplitting.](http://www.douglas-self.com/MUSEUM/LOCOLOCO/bec/bec.htm)"

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-22T13:23:49Z" title="05/22/2015 01:23  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 22, 2015</time> by GregroxMun**

> 
> Downloaded craft. Did not resemble images on box. Did not function as desired. 
> [http://i.imgur.com/S5HvSAW.png](http://i.imgur.com/S5HvSAW.png)
> 
> Also, box contained bobcat.
> 
> (Are you sure you uploaded the right one?)

Sorry about that. You have there a first mad experiment to get a ship to orbit powered by coal. Didn't work out terribly well (i.e. not at all). 

I've updated the link and here it is again: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/f67jromycf6rxu9/Make%20fuel%202.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/f67jromycf6rxu9/Make%20fuel%202.craft?dl=0)

Haha, now we need a coal-fired rocket.

"The Victorian Age accelerated. Starships fueled by coal and powered by Steam, leaving history devastated in it's wake" - The Doctor
